title: No Mails visible in any folder/ hitting "properties " and "repair folder" makes it visible in one folder. Repeating the procedure in another works, but mails disappear in the first one again. Troubleshoot procedures #1,2,3 not working
content:
Opening Thunderbird after Computer restart: -> no messages in any folder visible Hitting Properties and "Repair folder" makes them visible Repeating procedure on another folder works, but the mails in the folder repaired before disappear again I tried the procedures #1,2,3, deleting the MSF Files, always with program restart had no positive results

Only POP accounts

thank you in advance
creator: tichmann

title: Thunderbird can´t send SMTP
content:
Hello, I have two email accounts with gmx Mail. One is working fine, the other suddenly stopped sending SMTP Messages. I resetted the password on gmail but that didn´t solve the problem. I turned AVAST Antivirus off but problem remained. What can I do about that?

Using Thunderbird 102.6.1 and Windows 10
creator: kombuchabaer

title: Regarding Folder Compaction
content:
I like this feature where Thunderbird detects smartly that a lot of emails have been deleted and/or moved and hence the underlying .sqlite folders need to be compacted. However I have the following suggestions towards the same

  1. The compaction can be scheduled on exit of TB client. This is to ensure and avoid errors like folder is in use.
  2. Size of the folder when compaction be triggered be left configurable from the Config Editor. As of now I guess it is best left to TB client to decide the same based on a host of parameters.
creator: lavanyadeepak

title: No IMAP folders except inbox and deleted (Linux)
content:
I've just installed Linux Lite with Thunderbird on an old PC. I manually set up IMAP email using the server on my web hosting company. (I always have to do this as the server name isn't obvious.)

I have 21 server folders but none of them appear except for 'inbox' and 'deleted.' Not even junk or spam appear. I've checked that these folders with their contents still appear on EM Client (Windows) Aquamail (Android) and Roundcube webmail.

If I search for a message in one of the missing folders it does not appear although "Search subfolders" is selected.

I've seen advice to right-click on the account name and select "subscribe" but there is no such menu item. (The menu has only Get messages, Open in new tab, Open in new window, Search messages, New folder, Mark all folders read and Settings.) I've been all around the settings and cannot find any option to subscribe to folders. I've shut down and re-started but no change.

There is another odd thing, I presume unrelated: a group of messages from one sender appear in Thunderbird with today's date although they are a few months old. They appear correctly in other clients.
creator: TonyWoolf

title: Can send email but cant receive email
content:
I have used thunderbird for years but now cant receive emails. Weird issue is i can send email out.

attached my setting info.
creator: SumoBot

title: Message Reply not saved in Sent folder
content:
I am using the latest version of Thunderbird on a Windows computer. I have no Thunderbird extensions and am using all of the default settings. 

When I create and send a message it is saved in the Sent folder, but when I reply to a message it is not saved in the Sent Folder, although the message does actually get sent. There are no error messages.

I have tried re-installing Thunderbird, compacting each folder, repairing each folder, and turning off my security software, all to no avail.

I tried researching the issue but could not find anything that would pertain to this problem.

I would appreciate any technical support you can provide.

Thank you.
creator: SumoBot

title: Thunderbird Font Sizes
content:
First some feedback: Please don't allow references to Thunderbird menu items in answers unless they include the full menu path and are kept up-to-date as Thunderbird changes. Trying to figure out how to fix my problem, I found top 10 contributor responses referring to Thunderbird menu path in Thunderbird 102.1.0 (64-bit) Tools > Settings > General, which doesn't exist in Thunderbird 102.4.2 (64-bit); however, Edit > Settings > General does exist. (I know this problem is not just on Mozilla's forum, but with IT help everywhere.)

My "problems": 1. When I set Fonts & Colors to Default (DejaVu Sans), size 16 (what?), it reverts to sans-serif (is that the correct behavior?), but after closing the settings page, exiting and restarting Thunderbird 102.4.2 (64-bit), and either replying to an email or composing a new email, the font size defaults to "medium" and the actual size of a text "W" is 12 pixels (0.131 inches on a 24" 1920x1080 monitor, which would be 9.4 pts). A "large" "W" is 13 pixels high. I shouldn't have to change the size of the font every time I create a new email...which has been said before and apparently NOT fixed.

2. When "medium" and "large" text is printed on an HP OfficeJet, whether I print the email or a screenshot of the email, the height of the printed 12 and 13 pixel "W"s is 8.9 and 9.6 point (1 pt = 1/72"), respectively. In fact it appears that the three (proportional/monospace/minimum) size settings have little to do with the font sizes used. For example (respective settings): for 24/18/10, default/medium "W"s are 18 pixels, tiny/large "W"s are 13/21 pixels for 24/24/24, default/medium "W"s are 18 pixels, tiny/large "W"s are 18/21 pixels for 16/16/10, default/medium "W"s are 12 pixels, tiny/large "W"s are 8/13 pixels for 18/18/12, default/medium "W"s are 13 pixels, tiny/large "W"s are 10/16 pixels for 20/20/12, default/medium "W"s are 14 pixels, tiny/small/large "W"s are 12/13/18 pixels for 20/20/10, default/medium "W"s are 14 pixels, tiny/small/large "W"s are 12/13/18 pixels Stated another way: there is no rational relationship between the number settings used and the font size options or what is actually printed. At least if they were pixel sizes, some could figure out how large they'll display...

It took well over 2 hours of searching on line to no avail and finally using trial and error to figure out how to control font sizes well enough so when someone asks me to use font size 14 because of their aging eyes, I might actually be able to figure out what medium setting I need. (I didn't bother testing the monospace font size.)
creator: SumoBot

title: How to clean up Thunderbird and Eliminate Unnecessary Files
content: It takes a long time to backup my Thunderbird profile files (20+ years of use). There are numerous ".final" files and others that seem to be unnecessary and drastically slow down the backup process. How can I clean up the needed Thunderbird files and eliminate the others?
creator: hborchids

title: not downloading email
content: all of a sudden Thunderbird isn't downloading our emails. I am able to send email though. Down at the bottom is says "searching" and then nothing happens when I try to "get messages". Any ideas?
creator: ag3

title: unable to write the email to the mailbox in Thunderbird
content:
Ever since I upgraded Thunderbird to version 102.6.1, I keep getting the message "unable to write the email to the mailbox in Thunderbird"

There's plenty of disk space and permissions haven't been changed. And then I tried creating a new profile, and it worked until I shut down the PC for the night, and in the morning, the problem recurred in the new profile too.

This is greatly hampering my work, so please help me.

I have donated to Thunderbird and will continue to do so if this problem can be resolved.
creator: HankFriedman

title: hard time seeing
content:
Hello,

I really enjoy using Thunderbird as my email program; I have been using it for years. I currently use Thunderbird 102.5.0. However, my eyesight has gotten poorer after my stroke, and I am having trouble differentiating unread emails from read emails. I was wondering if there was a way that I could change the bold for unread/unbold for read to something else, like different colors or fonts for read vs. unread, or maybe making the green unread dot a different, more bold color or size?

Thank you,

George Hutton
creator: GHUTTON446

title: Unarchive messages
content: By mistake I had archived some messages. How do I unarchive them?? I only have seen instructions on where they are archived, but none on how to unarchive. Very annoying that. Tks.
creator: johnb.acad

title: Put on Troubleshoot moding and now it does not go off.
content: Trying to find how to access archived messages, I had put my Thunderbird on Troubleshoot mode. Now, the quit Troubleshoot mode does not appear to me so to quit it?? What happens? How to get rid off it?? Tks.

content: I had already some help(disble Sophos, system restore, though without success), but after the system restart there were no traces of the previous exchange of messages

title: ow to setup folders to show read and unread email
content: There used to be a way to have Thunderbird show read and unread email counts in each folder. Has it been removed are am I just going blind? Can't find it.
creator: frankzen

title: Contact list entries missing when in TO or BCC fields in a new email
content:
I have some contact lists. In one of these I have 20 contacts. I can clearly see these when in the contact lists properties or if I search the address book for that contact list name.

Once I select this contact list in a new email using either TO or BCC, only 18 show up.

Anyone have any suggestions?
creator: SumoBot

title: junk advertising emails with strange headers
content: I have been getting unsolicited advertising from many vendors that all have similar headers. There is a strange character that looks like 4 zeros, 2 on top and 2 on bottom that I cannot copy to make a junk filter. It looks like it is a spacer between characters. I have been junking them manually but wonder what the characters are and how to junk them automatically. I have tried to go to the bottom of the email to unsubscribe, but the unsubscribe goes to the vendor. I am wondering what the strange character is and how to automatically dump it. I am attaching some of the headers as a jpg file.
creator: patnsandy

title: Cannot install add-ons in Thunderbird...
content: I am unable to install add-ons for Thunderbird for my Chromebook that I have installed via the embedded Linux OS that's in Chromebook. Inside the app(Thunderbird), I go to addons.thunderbird.net and attempt to install an add-on and this box with this button inside it pops up and I have to click on that button to confirm installation of that add-on. Well, I try clicking on that button and nothing happens and that box doesn't go away. I enclosed a screenshot to give you an idea of what I'm talking about.
creator: eatshit2016

title: Overcoming this 01-01-1970 ghost messages
content:
Whenever items are deleted from Junk folder (Unified View) I am getting at least 10 lines with 01-01-1970 dates. It takes several minutes for these to clear up and at times persist between sessions too.

I do have the latest version of Thunderbird installed.
creator: lavanyadeepak

I have ran Thunderbird in the Troubleshooting mode, I made a new profile, Searched for help and Google has found nothing. It's been doing this for a couple of months. If you have any suggestions.
